intro: Cynanchum decorsei, commonly known as the beautiful milkweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes other milkweeds known for their distinctive floral structures. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while the stems are covered in fine hairs. Cynanchum decorsei is also characterized by its latex-containing sap, which can be toxic to some animals.
